thread.title: H.S. girls tennis: Wayne Hills unexpectedly wins 13th straight Passiac County tournament title.
thread.title_full: H.S. girls tennis: Wayne Hills unexpectedly wins 13th straight Passiac County tournament title.

title: H.S. girls tennis: Wayne Hills unexpectedly wins 13th straight Passiac County tournament title.
text:
Pages: 1 2 > display on one page 
WAYNE – The notion that the Wayne Hills girls tennis team wasn’t going to win this year’s Passaic County tournament championship didn’t sit well with Divya Yagamurthy. 
The Patriots senior said her team "might’ve been a little offended," but also felt it could work in their favor. 
"People might’ve underestimated us," Yagamurthy said. 
"But we knew we had a strong team." 
On Monday, Wayne Hills’ remade team showed how strong by winning an unprecedented 13th consecutive county crown. The Patriots totaled 17 points while West Milford and Pompton Lakes followed with 13 and 12, respectively. 
"We were the underdogs … no one thought we were going to win," Wayne Hills junior Jess Goldman said. 
"People were coming up to us saying, ‘I have no idea how you did it.’ " 
Wayne Hills accomplished the feat by winning three of the five individual crowns, including Goldman’s victory at first singles. 
Passaic County’s new singles queen topped West Milford’s Tess Korinko,7-5, 6-0. 
"I was so nervous … I was freaking out the entire day," Goldman said. 
"The finals were supposed to be Friday. Then they weren’t, so I was like, ‘Oh my God! I’m going to be freaking out the entire weekend.’ 
"I was really nervous for the first set but after that, it disappeared. I was like, ‘Jessica … you want this’ and I pulled myself together." 
One court over, Goldman’s classmate Katarina Kolarski captured the second-singles title by beating West Milford’s Theresa Fernbacher, 7-5, 6-4. 
Wayne Hills’ third win came at second doubles, where seniors Hima Tallam and Yagamurthy bested Pompton Lakes’ Lauren Sanford and Charla Lim, 6-4, 6-3. 
Tallam and Yagamurthy played tennis as underclassmen but sat out last season to concentrate on their SATs and advanced placement courses. 
They both said they were happy with their test scores and happier to return to the court this fall. 
"We wanted to play so badly last year, but we just couldn’t," Tallam said. 
"We still played all the time but not with the team. I feel like winning this was our big comeback." 
While Wayne Hills was wrapping up another team trophy, Pompton Lakes also finished off a strong tournament by taking a pair of titles. 
Junior Charlotte Yates captured the third singles trophy, knocking off Wayne Hills’ Maddy Flynn, 7-5, 6-0. 
Cardinal seniors Kelly Brennan and Clarissa Abella finished the proceedings by outlasting West Milford’s Abby Johnson and Allison Borrelli in second doubles, 6-2, 2-6, 6-4. © 2015 North Jersey Media Group Tags:
